sect2.title: Installation of OpenSSH
sect2.para: OpenSSH runs as two processes when connecting to other computers. The first process is a privileged process and controls the issuance of privileges as necessary. The second process communicates with the network. Additional installation steps are necessary to set up the proper environment which are performed by the following commands:

userinput.command: mkdir /var/empty && chown root:sys /var/empty && groupadd sshd && useradd -c 'sshd privsep' -d /var/empty -g sshd -s /bin/false sshd
